results.title: Shades of Puffing Billy
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Antonio Colacino
results.brief_description: The Puffing Billy miniature railway runs between the towns of Belgrave and Emerald in the Dandenong Mountains of Victoria. Supported and operated by amateur railway enthusiasts, with the assistance of the Victorian Government Railways, the Puffing Billy has become famous throughout Australia. Takes a light-hearted look at the problems of operating the railway. An affectionate salute to the people who keep this little railway running and to locomotive enthusiasts everywhere.

results.title: Shades of grey
results.brief_description: A fictional drama which portrays an American company investigating the incidence of sexual harassment within its own organisation. In doing so, it attempts to develop a wide-reaching concept, interpretation and definition of sexual harrassment.

results.title: Shades of difference
results.creator_credit: Cinetel Film Production Services and Frank Heimans
results.brief_description: Displays and discusses the work of two Australian painters, with their own explanations and responses to the comments of a random selection of people asked to view their works. Michael Dulics uses pictorial symbolism as a vehicle for social commentary. Col Jordan creates abstract optical effects.

results.title: Seymour: the relevance of sociology
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Based on the Open University film Seymour. Short segments from the film are shown and Ronald Fletcher looks at the behaviour of the characters in the light of sociological theories. Points out that sociology brings new perspective to the understa

results.title: Seymour's view
results.creator_credit: Jack Zalkalns and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: An extra terrestial being, Seymour, gives us his views on how language development seems to occur in our society and how it could develop with a little more positive involvement on the part of parents.

results.title: Sexy beast
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Thomas, Fox Searchlight Pictures, Film Four International, Kanzaman S A and Jonathan Glazer
results.brief_description: Gary (Ray Winstone) is a retired criminal, living in a luxurious Spanish villa with his ex-porn star wife and a couple of choice friends. The news of the impending arrival of Don (Ben Kingsley) - a former colleague of Don’s and a psychopath, puts the group on knife-edge. Don descends on the group like a hurricane - spewing foul language and oozing menace. His mission is to bring Gary back to London for a jewellery heist, masterminded by Teddy Bass (Ian MacShane). Gary’s refusal means little to Don as he cajoles, threatens, prods and manipulates Gary into taking the job. Don also works on intimidating the group, who are catatonic with fear and are on a helpless mission not to evoke Don’s anger. “Sexy beast” is a thriller/crime film that has a kinetic style that is at times reminiscent of Guy Ritchie. This film was Jonathon Glazer’s debut feature and Ben Kingsley was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Actor.

results.title: Sexually transmitted diseases (TEFC)
results.brief_description: An educational examination of sexually transmitted diseases, what they are, what the symptoms are and how easily they can be cured. The recurring theme is that most of the diseases can be completely cured if treated in the early stages. BEFORE SHOWING TO SCHOOLS IT IS ESSENTIAL THAT THIS VIDEO BE VIEWED BY TEACHERS FOR SUITABILITY.

results.title: Sexually transmitted diseases (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Film Corporation and Tasmania. Dept. of Health Services
results.brief_description: With the exception of influenza and the common cold, sexually transmitted diseases are the most widely spread of infectious diseases. However, most can be cured if treated in the early stages. Examines how STD’s are transmitted, those most at risk, symptoms and treatment. NB.: Contains explicit medical photographs and scenes of medical procedures. It is essential that this program be viewed by teachers to assess suitability before screening.

results.title: Sexuality and communication
results.brief_description: At an Ontario Science Center Symposium two doctors discuss many aspects of human sexuality in light-hearted but extremely scholarly explanations involving role playing, diagramatic representation of male and female sex organs, intercourse, premature ejaculation, frigidity, masturbation, and shows the importance of attitudes and feelings.
